content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position (5.0, 5.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0)
Use-case: Smelts iron ore with coal to produce iron plates, thereby supporting resource availability for lab crafting.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position (–27.0, –60.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at Position(x=–27.0, y=–60.0)
Use-case: Processes copper ore with coal to yield copper plates, which are required for copper cable production and ultimately for lab crafting support.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Usage:
 – When invoking functions like get_entities, supply parameters exactly as defined. Avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (e.g. “radius”) or passing extra positional arguments.
 
• Entity Retrieval and Iteration:
 – Always check that a returned collection isn’t None before iterating over it to prevent “NoneType is not iterable” errors.
 
• Lab Placement and Crafting:
 – Confirm that a Lab item is available in the inventory before attempting to place it.
 – Verify that all sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are available in the necessary quantities prior to launching lab crafting.
 
• Resource and Production Management:
 – Ensure that smelting operations complete successfully and yield the expected resource counts before progressing to dependent crafting steps.
 – Double-check resource supply chains to avoid shortages that lead to crafting errors.
